pull_request.title: Bump actions/github-script from 6 to 7
pull_request.body:
Bumps [actions/github-script](https://github.com/actions/github-script) from 6 to 7.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/github-script's releases.

v7.0.0

What's Changed

  • Add base-url option by @‚Äãrobandpdx in actions/github-script#429
  • Expose async-function argument type by @‚Äãviktorlott in actions/github-script#402, see for details https://github.com/actions/github-script#use-scripts-with-jsdoc-support
  • Update dependencies and use Node 20 by @‚Äãjoshmgross in actions/github-script#425

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãnavarroaxel made their first contribution in actions/github-script#285
  • @‚Äãrobandpdx made their first contribution in actions/github-script#429
  • @‚Äãviktorlott made their first contribution in actions/github-script#402

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/github-script/compare/v6.4.1...v7.0.0

v6.4.1

What's Changed

  • Add @‚Äãoctokit/plugin-request-log, to produce debug output for requests by @‚Äãmjpieters in actions/github-script#358
  • fix input handling by @‚Äãmjpieters in actions/github-script#357
  • Remove unused dependencies by @‚Äãmjpieters in actions/github-script#356
  • Default debug to current runner debug state by @‚Äãmjpieters in actions/github-script#363

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãmjpieters made their first contribution in actions/github-script#358

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/github-script/compare/v6.4.0...v6.4.1

v6.4.0

What's Changed

  • Bump json5 from 2.1.3 to 2.2.3 by @‚Äãdependabot in actions/github-script#319
  • Bump minimatch from 3.0.4 to 3.1.2 by @‚Äãdependabot in actions/github-script#320
  • Add node-fetch by @‚Äãdanmichaelo in actions/github-script#321

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãjongwooo made their first contribution in actions/github-script#313
  • @‚Äãaustinvazquez made their first contribution in actions/github-script#306
  • @‚Äãdanmichaelo made their first contribution in actions/github-script#321

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/github-script/compare/v6.3.3...v6.4.0

v6.3.3

What's Changed

  • Update @actions/glob to 0.3.0 by @‚Äãnineinchnick in actions/github-script#279

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãnineinchnick made their first contribution in actions/github-script#279

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/github-script/compare/v6.3.2...v6.3.3

v6.3.2

What's Changed

  • Update @‚Äãactions/core to 1.10.0 by @‚Äãrentziass in actions/github-script#295

... (truncated)

Commits
  • e69ef54 Merge pull request #425 from actions/joshmgross/node-20
  • ee0914b Update licenses
  • d6fc56f Use @types/node for Node 20
  • 384d6cf Fix quotations in tests
  • 8472492 Only validate GraphQL previews
  • 84903f5 Remove node-fetch from type
  • 5349cf9 Merge branch 'main' into joshmgross/node-20
  • ecae9eb Merge pull request #402 from typed-actions/export-types
  • 044ebbb Merge branch 'main' into export-types
  • 6b5d3ea Merge pull request #429 from robandpdx/add-base-url-option
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=actions/github-script&package-manager=github_actions&previous-version=6&new-version=7)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
@BlazDT,

I wasn't able to reproduce the issue. Are you sure that the extension is the reason? The rule you have created disables userscripts, and the AdGuard Browser Assistant isn't a userscript. Could you be referring to the legacy browser assistant, perhaps? Regardless, it would be helpful if you could create an issue in the corresponding repository.

The site works fine on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: Url tracking filter does not work on bilibili, it removes filtering params before loading, but the website add "vd_source" param back to ulr after loading
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.12.2.1415

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1Sj411E7Mj/?vd_source=898sdufds8766ehhm

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, Legitimate URL Shortener

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, CJX's Annoyances List, EasyList China

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
For any bilibili video link, for example "https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1Sj411E7Mj/?vd_source=898sdufds8766ehhm", it removes the vd_source at first and then adds vd_source part back to the url. After some testing, I found out that vd_source is just a unique id for any login user. This might be impossible to remove.
However if I am watching any video, clicking from side bar still includes tracking params.
like the screenshot below. I replaced the vd_source part with some random characters.
</comment>

2. <screenshot>
![CleanShot 2023-11-14 at 23 53 28@2x](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/18389334/082bf4a1-2ae2-4003-a120-fecc04773007)

issue.title: Adguard tracking protection filter rule breaks Netflix watched history
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

none, uBlock Origin 1.53.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

netflix.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

When I am watching media on Netflix.com on Brave Desktop I noticed that after November 2nd, 2023 the Netflix watch history did not update anymore. 

Going through the uBlock logger I found this rule getting enforced when I stop a video: 

> Filter
> ||netflix.com*/msl*/*event*/
> Filter list
> [AdGuard Tracking Protection]
> 

Temporarily disabling this rule via a dynamic URL filtering rule 
`www.netflix.com https://www.netflix.com/msl/playapi/cadmium/ xmlhttprequest allow`
immediately fixes the issue and media gets added to the watched list on Netflix again. 

Please modify/remove ` ||netflix.com*/msl*/*event*/` from you filter list. 

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
These buttons are not social media widgets, i.e. they do not perform the functions associated with social media: "share", "like", etc. Therefore, according to the filtering policy, they cannot be added to the general filter. 
But you can block them in a user rules:
`ocdsb.ca##.socialMedia`

issue.title: Adguard tracking protection filter rule breaks Netflix watched history

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

none, uBlock Origin 1.53.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

netflix.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

When I am watching media on Netflix.com on Brave Desktop I noticed that after November 2nd, 2023 the Netflix watch history did not update anymore. 

Going through the uBlock logger I found this rule getting enforced when I stop a video: 

```
Filter
||netflix.com*/msl*/*event*/
Filter list
[AdGuard Tracking Protection]
```


Temporarily disabling this rule via a dynamic URL filtering rule 
`www.netflix.com https://www.netflix.com/msl/playapi/cadmium/ xmlhttprequest allow`
immediately fixes the issue and media gets added to the watched list on Netflix again. 

Please modify/remove ` ||netflix.com*/msl*/*event*/` from you filter list. 

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
